alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Burlington County through 415 PM EDT... At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Willingboro, or 12 miles east of Camden, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Laurel, Willingboro, Medford, Lumberton, Burlington, Mount Holly, Riverside, Presidential Lakes Estates, Beverly, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Ramblewood, Leisuretowne, Jacksonville, Georgetown, Presidential Lakes, Browns Mills, Jobstown, Columbus and Marlton. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 6. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 37 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
